definition: the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels
old variant of 峰[feng1]
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Will Ferguson revitalise Owen's career in much the same manner he did Eric Cantona's?
sentences.chinese: 爵爷能让欧文的职业生像坎通纳那样涯峰回路转吗？

sentences.english: In this way, they persevered , Strive to turn one day.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，他们坚持下来了，奋斗到了峰回路转的一天。

sentences.english: There are always twists and turns in life.
However, in a twist to the transfer, Palladino has decided not to go to the Grifoni.
sentences.chinese: 然而现在峰回路转，帕拉迪诺决定拒绝加盟热那亚。

sentences.english: I suddenly really understand Song Wei's paintings.
sentences.chinese: 我对宋微画作的理解顿时峰回路转。

sentences.english: But now the tide may be turning in its favour.
Different people love to play the game, end has is back.
sentences.chinese: 不同的人去玩爱情这场游戏，结局已经是峰回路转。

sentences.english: Sooner than it seems, life turns around.
sentences.chinese: 很快生活就会峰回路转。

sentences.english: These are just the sort of traits needed to turn a company around.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，这些都是使一个公司峰回路转的必要因素。

definition: lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
winding/(fig.) complicated
impossible to unravel/confusing
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment
dramatic
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
twists and turns
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
unexpected (idiom)/surprising
